newsitem.title: USA: Cascade one of most active issues ever.
newsitem.headline: Cascade one of most active issues ever.

text.p: The sharp decline in Cascade Communications Corp's share price on Friday put the stock in the record books as one of the most heavily traded in a single day.
A Nasdaq spokesman said Casade's volume of almost 43.7 million shares was the ninth-largest single-day volume in the history of the market.

Cascade fell 23-1/8 points in Nasdaq trading on Friday to end the day at 41. The swoon came after several Wall Street analysts downgraded the stock on concern that its fast-paced growth as a supplier of Internet infrastructure equipment may be slowing.

Only a handful of stocks have had more eventful days. One penny stock, Comparator Systems Inc, a maker of fingerprint identification systems, holds the activity record, with 177 million shares traded on May 7, 1996.

Comparator set the mark for the second, third and fourth most-active trading days. Those sessions were also in early May 1996, a few days before Nasdaq halted trading in the stock and launched an investigation into stock fraud allegations.

Intel Corp holds the fifth and sixth spots, trading 68 million shares on January 17, 1996, and 55 million shares on July 19, 1995. Microsoft Corp ranks seventh and Cisco Systems Inc eighth for active days in 1994.
Nasdaq delisted Comparator in June 1996. The company eventually settled charges of fraud and record-keeping violations with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.
